document.heading: Commission on African-American Affairs Establishment Act of 2012

history.narrative: Law 19-106, the “Commission on African-American Affairs Establishment Act of 2012”, was introduced in Council and assigned Bill No. 19-213, which was referred to the Committee on Aging and Community Affairs. The Bill was adopted on first and second readings on December 20, 2012, and January 4, 2012, respectively. Signed by the Mayor on January 20, 2012, it was assigned Act No. 19-281 and transmitted to both Houses of Congress for its review. D.C. Law 19-106 became effective on March 14, 2012.
